page.title: 14WOODLAND
page.content: Our area has many trees, both new and old ones. There are obviously trees in hedges, but the main areas are around Hazlegrove, Yarcombe Wood and Forty Acre Copse. Hazlegrove Park used to be full of fine Elms and there was a grove of Elms right up the drive, but due to Dutch Elm Disease many Elms had to be cut down. Now a new grove has been planted in an effort to recover the sight of the lost trees. Only deciduous trees grow here. Yarcombe Wood covers between two hundred and two hundred and fifty acres, and both Deciduous and Evergreen trees grow here. Forty Acre Copse covers, as the name suggests, forty acres(!), and there are also both deciduous and evergreen trees in this wood.
